Question: The Jordanaires sang harmony, as they had on The Steve Allen Show; they would work with this person through the 1960s.
Hints: At the time, this person was variously billed as "The King of Western Bop", "The Hillbilly Cat", and "The Memphis Flash".
Though Phillips no longer had the right to release any this person material, he made sure the session was captured on tape.
After his first appearance, on January 28, this person stayed in town to record at RCA's New York studio.
